sub_title: Partner, founder and public developer at Stipo
summary:
"We're fools whether we dance or not, so we might as well dance."
"The city is wilder than you think and kinder than you think. It is a valley and you are a horse in it. It is a house and you are a child in it."
"Cities have the capability of providing something for everybody, only because, and only when, they are created by everybody."
"Anything is possible, except skiing through a revolving door."
    
I love great places where people meet. I am devoted to human scale, mingled, multi-layered cities, great public space, involved communities and true sustainability.

With my team STIPO, we want to be involved in the long term, in developing the city, sharing knowledge and training courses. I love working with people of all kinds, interests and disciplines, creative and surprising processes, thinking and acting, short and long term.

I work on human scale area development, transformation, placemaking, the city at eye level, organic processes, inclusive regeneration, the creative economy, social innovation, co-creation, community development, user based streets, squares and parks, the civic economy, co-created visions and strategies, system change.

Our multidisciplinary team for urban development, STIPO, stands for STrategic and Innovative Product development in an Open source environment. We innovate by sharing, we work open source. We are based in Amsterdam, Rotterdam, Athens and Milan.

I like to work both on a local, city and regional level and am involved in international exchange. I am board member for several foundations such as Placemaking Europe and Stichting Stadmakersfonds.

treasury_media.title: 2015 06 The City at Eye Level, Stipo, Future of Places Stockholm
treasury_media.description: Presentation of The City at Eye Level on how to create better streets, better plinths, better sidewalks and what the role of buildings is. From public space to public realm. Stipo, UN Habitat, Future of Places, Project for Public Spaces, Gehl Architects, PUCRS University of Porto Alegre.

projects.title: Stipo Projects in 2015 - Books & Publications
projects.description:
Books / Publications
- A Cidade ao Nivel dos Olhos: editor and co-authoer to the new Brazil / Portuguese version of The City at Eye Level, together with FAUPUCRS (Paulo Horn Regal and Renee Nycolaas), university of Porto Alegre; UN Habitat, Project for Public Spaces, Copenhagenize, Gehl Architects and Future of Places; and 90 co-authors internationally
- Chapter in De Stoep, a book on the sidewalk as a social meeting place, by Sander van der Ham (Stipo), Daniel Heusen and Eric van Ulden
- Chapter in The Vacant City, book by KÉK Budapest, Hungary; written by Levente Polyák and others

contributors.headline: Partner, founder and public developer at Stipo

projects.title: Stipo Projects in 2015 - Lectures and Conferences
projects.description:
Lectures / Conferences:
- Lectures about The City at Eye Level: City Council of Utrecht on the Central Station Area; De Stoep book launch at the Pakhuis de Zwijger in Amsterdam; placemaking workshop and transformation for Budapest Design Week; office and team of Gehl Architects in Copenhagen; Placemaking Roosendaal for mayor and aldermen (college B&W); Walk with Fred Kent and Kathy Madden in city center of Rotterdam; City at Eye Level brainstorm with City of Prague in Amsterdam; 
- Lectures about ZOHO and Organic Transformation / Slow Urbanism: at KÉK, Budapest @Prezi HQ in Hungary; Honig Fabriek in Nijmegen; Jonge Honden in Utrecht; Expertendag in Antwerp, Belgium; Yacht client conference in ZOHO Rotterdam; 
- Organic development of Russische buurt in Zaandam (organische wijkontwikkeling), with residents, entrepreneurs, owners and city experts
- Barcelona PPS Market Cities Conference about placemaking and markets; with Project for Public Spaces (Fred Kent, Ethan Kent, Vanessa September, Kathy Madden) and Urban Space Agency (Peter Groenendaal)
- Communicative City Award brainstorm in Amsterdam
- Presentation at the Urban Transformation Conference in Rotterdam among others with former prime minister Balkenende
- Jury member for the 100 Years of Challenge Housing (Prijsvraag 100 jaar Wonen) of housing corporation Havensteder; challenge to transform offices into housing; winner The Hub of David Hess, Kraaijvanger Architects; realised in Het Gele Gebouw

contributors.headline: Partner, founder and public developer at Stipo

projects.title: Stipo Projects in 2015 - Organic Transformation
projects.description:
Organic transformation, area development, new urban development, multi-stakeholder, vacancy, public developers (organische transformatie, gebiedsontwikkeling, co-creatie, leegstand, publieke ontwikkelaars):
- Organic Transformation of Rijnhaven Oost in Alphen aan den Rijn (organische transformatie), with local owners, businesses, project developers, placemakers, temporary use, recreation enterprise, restaurant owners (waterrecreatie, jachthaven); transforming the area gradually from a degraded monofunctional and partially vacant business area into a mixed urban area with housing, work, recreation, water and a harbour
- Organic Transformation of Rijnhuizen in Nieuwegein, starting the Club Rhijnhuizen for property owners, developers, residents, businesses and employees; creating a business case as public developer for the area management in the next years; with Emilie Vlieger of Vlieger projecten, and Theo Stauttener of Stad2, for Province of Utrecht and City of Nieuwegein
- Kantorenloods Haarlemmermeer, first focussing on the Organic Transformation of Hoofddorp Beukenhorst West in co-creation with property owners, developers and users; placemaking and plinth strategy; business case with Nathalie van Hoeven of BEAT Development, Podium centre for architecture Haarlemmermeer, Urhahn Urban Design, Van Dijk & Co, SLA / Peter van Assche and City of Haarlemmermeer
- founder and board member of re:Kreators Association, international network for public developers with Holzmarkt Berlin (Genossenschaft fur Urbane Kreativität and Mörchenpark), Darwin Ecosystème Bordeaux, Shuffle Festival London, KÉK Budapest, PB43 Copenhagen, Make a Point Bucharest, ateliermob / Largo Residencias Lisbon, STEALTH Belgrado, Pakhuis de Zwijger Amsterdam and ZOHO Rotterdam; working towards an alternative EU Urban Agenda; sharing and learning inspiration

contributors.headline: Partner, founder and public developer at Stipo

projects.title: Stipo Projects in 2015 - Organic Transformation, follow up
projects.description:
- Erasmusveld Den Haag, co-creation with area project developers on a joint strategy for sustainability and energy (duurzaamheid), with Stad2 (Theo Stauttener and Chee-Key Theo)
- BO MIRT South-Holland, Chances in Vacancy and Transformation on realising housing (trekker tafel Leegstand en Transformatie voor Zuidvleugel Randstad)
- Korthagenhuis Eigen Haard, Workshop and vision for care house in Amsterdam Noord, with a new mix of young starters, students, elderly, refugees and a great public place on the ground floor as result
- Expert in FINC network of inner city development of Province of Utrecht; cases: Hof van Cartesius Utrecht; Wijk bij Duurstede Town Center; Placemaking Masterclass Veenendaal
- Co-starter of the Amsterdam network for temporary social use of public buildings LOLA (Leegstands OpLossers Amsterdam); among others filling up an incubator of 20,000 m2 of building owner MPS, Laan van Kronenburg Amstelveen in combination with refugees / COA, with Simon van Dommelen and Nathalie van Hoeven of BEAT Development

contributors.headline: Partner, founder and public developer at Stipo

projects.title: Stipo Projects in 2015 - The City at Eye Level and Placemaking
projects.description:
The City at Eye Level and Placemaking:
- A Cidade ao Nivel dos Olhos: Launch of the new Brazil / Portuguese version of The City at Eye Level, together with FAUPUCRS (Paulo Horn Regal and Renee Nycolaas), university of Porto Alegre; UN Habitat, Project for Public Spaces, Copenhagenize, Gehl Architects and Future of Places
- Key note speech on The City at Eye Level / A Cidade ao Nivel dos Olhos at the 1o Congresso Espacos Publicos of  FAUPUCRS Porto Alegre
- Key note speech on The City at Eye Level at the international Future of Places / UN Habitat conference in Stockholm
- Placegame at Praca Francisco Alves in Porto Alegre, Brazil
- Lecture and dialogue with The City of Sao Paulo on A Cidade ao Nivel dos Olhos / The City at Eye Level
- Place Game on Rotterdam’s Oostplein, with the City of Rotterdam and Stakeholders
- Place Game in Veenendaal’s city center
- City at Eye Level analysis for Amsterdam’s central city Spuistraat / NZ Voorburgwal northern part, in co-creation with the street’s stakeholders, dealing with balance in the city (balans in de stad, balancing local businesses and residents with tourism) and a better city at eye level
- Street workshop and analysis of Amsterdam’s inner city street Warmoesstraat
- Jane’s Walk in The Binckhorst, The Hague (Den Haag) for the MIRT Conference, with Peter Groenendaal, Christien Stoker, Dino van Dal and Sabrina Lindemann
- Three day Masterclass City at Eye Level and Placemaking, analysing plazas, streets and developing area and city strategies, for KTH University Stockholm, with Future of Places
- Session City at Eye Level and Placemaking for municipal directors of Brabant West in Corsendonk
- Presentation for the Utrecht City Council on The City at Eye Level around the Utrecht Central Station area

- Expert in the FINC network for inner city development in the province of Utrecht; cases: organic transformation of Amersfoort Oliemolenkwartier; Presentation for PS Utrecht From Making to Being City and the Human scale (Van Stad Maken naar Stad Zijn en menselijke maat); Networked Sustainability and Energy transition in Zeist; Woerden Snellerpoort 
- NIMB€, Nieuwe Investeringen Met Bestaande Euro’s, innovation programme on using existing value and financial streams in areas such as health care, energy and private investment for integrated urban development

contributors.headline: Partner, founder and public developer at Stipo

projects.title: Cities [un]planned - the Tirana edition
projects.description:
Fourth edition in a series of international exchanges, learning about and developing new mechanisms of urban development. We look at the city from an anthropological point of view, focussing on the dynamics between the ‘lived city’ (urban residents, entrepreneurs, bottom-up initiatives) and the ‘planned city’ (institutions, developers, governments, top-down).

Focus for the Tirana [Un] Planned trip is organic development. What are the mechanisms behind organic development, what are the instruments used, and where are the limits to spontaneous city and is more planning needed. 

Participants: interesting mix of directors from housing corporations, strategists working for the cities in The Netherlands, a former minister of the Irish government, independent professionals, artists, and social workers.

projects.title: Projects 2012 followup
projects.description:
Projects 2012 follow up
* Expert for the national experience tank 'Waardecreatie in de wijk, bewonersbedrijven en economisch denken' (Local Value Creation, social enterprises and economic approach), Ministry of the Interior (BZK) and Platform31
* International Plinth Book 'The City at Eye Level, Lessons for Street Plinths' - a collaborative book with over 30 authors and international best practices, author and editor
* Rotterdamse Voorhoede, het vernieuwingsnetwerk van strategen van alle woningcorporaties en de gebiedsmanagers gemeente Rotterdam; kennisontwikkeling voor nieuwe impulsen voor de stad
* Gebiedsaanpak voor geleefde en geplande stad Oostelijke Eilanden Amsterdam, ism Urhahn, in opdracht van een coalitie van gebiedseigenaren
* Kwartiermaker voor de oprichting van twee frontlijnteams in de wijken Kroeven en Langdonk, voor woningcorporatie Aramis AlleeWonen, gemeente en Traverse in Roosendaal
* Nieuwe Maatschappelijke Investeerders 2020, landelijk kennisnetwerk voor nieuwe business modellen voor bestaande waardestromen door de wijk
* Training Introductie Ruimtelijke Ordening en Nieuwe stedelijke ontwikkeling voor VNG Academie en VNG Trainee
* Toekomstvisie Albrandswaard in co-creatie met de bevolking en stakeholders, gericht op een grotere zelforganisatie en de wording van de Regiegemeente; relatie met structuurvisie
* Marktconsultatie August Allebéplein, Gemeente Amsterdam, Stadsdeel Nieuw-West
* CityThinkLab: het lab voor de stad van de toekomst, in samenwerking met Inspiring Cities, Pakhuis de Zwijger en vele andere netwerken: Home City, Future City, Shared City, Dis/Connected City, In/Formal City, Shared City, Playing City, Arrival City en de finale met het Spel van de Stad
* Docent en mede vormgever van het excellentieprogramma Design in Society, ontwerpdenken voor complexe stedelijke vraagstukken, Hogeschool van Amsterdam

contributors.headline: Partner, founder and public developer at Stipo

projects.title: Projects Stipo in 2012
projects.description:
Eerder in 2012:
* Landelijk onderzoek De Omslag naar verandering in stedelijke vernieuwingsaanpak en wijkaanpak van woningcorporaties sinds de crisis, voor Platform Corpovenista
* Kostenverhaal bij organische transformatie, landelijke verkenning voor Cruquiusgebied en Zeeburgerpad, ism Stad2, voor Gemeente Amsterdam, Stadsdeel Oost
* Reeks optredens en lezingen, waaronder voor de Stad Antwerpen, Barcelona Regional, de bestuursadviseurs Almere, PAUME Utrecht, Jonge Ambtenarendag, Atelier Rijksbouwmeester, Creatieve Stad Haarlem, Projectleiders Hoogeveen, Creatieve Stad Eindhoven, Kunstliefde Utrecht, Portaal en Projectleiders Gemeente Utrecht, sessie Zelforganisatie op conferentie De Wijk Verdient Het van ministerie BZK; stadsgeruchtensessie over Thuis Voelen in de wijk
* Reeks gastcolleges, waaronder voor de Hogeschool Utrecht, Academie voor Bouwkunst Amsterdam, Urban Management Hogeschool van Amsterdam, Summerschool Zaanstad, rondgang Duurzaamheid in stedelijke vernieuwing voor delegatie St Petersburg en AgentschapNL, Masterclasses Landelijk Platform voor wijk- en buurtbeheer LPB en Leergang Corpovenista
* Korte adviseringen voor Archiprix Enschede, Van der Pekbuurt Amsterdam voor Bureau Monumenten en Archeologie, Nationaal Programma Zuid voor ministerie BZK en gemeente Rotterdam, nieuwe impulsen voor gebieds- en wijkprogramma Inverdan West en Zaandam West
* Atelier Economische Waardeketens in de Binckhorst, over de waarde van de autoindustrie, bouw en grafisch; Stroom en Gemeente Den Haag, sessie voor de Architectuurbiënnale, in samenwerking met Joost Beunderman van Research 00:\ en met de bedrijven uit het gebied
* Marktconsultatie Mr Visserplein, Gemeente Amsterdam, Stadsdeel Centrum
* Verkenning Eerstelijnszorg voor stedelijk vernieuwingsplan Aireystrook in Amsterdam Nieuw-West, woningcorporatie Eigen Haard
* Publicaties De Omslag, on how housing corporations in The Netherlands massively changed their strategies during the crisis; Stipo for Corpovenista

contributors.headline: Partner, founder and public developer at Stipo

projects.title: Projects Stipo 2011
projects.description:
2011:
* Plintenstrategie Binnenstad Rotterdam, Projectleider dS+V, OBR, Bureau Binnenstad en vele stakeholders binnenstad
* Gezamenlijke investeringsstrategie en gebiedsgericht werken, Gemeente Roosendaal, woningcorporatie Aramis AlleeWonen: 9 perspectieven in 3 maanden tijd met bewoners en stakeholders
* Natuurlijke wijkvernieuwing: opzetten van een netwerk en community of practice
* Begeleiden van wijk- en dorpsvisies gemeente Roosendaal, bewoners, woningcorporaties en wijkpartners; conform de aanpak 'natuurlijke wijkvernieuwing'
* Strategie Broedplaatsen, Bureau Broedplaatsen Amsterdam: onderzoek, advies en coalitievorming met marktleiders
* Plintenstrategie Weesperstraat, Amsterdam, stadsdeel Centrum
* Broedplaatsenstrategie, waardeketens en themabroedplaatsen, in co-creatie met de stakeholders uit de creatieve industrie in Amsterdam, Bureau Broedplaatsen Amsterdam
* Advisering over het 100% mode concept voor Arnhem Klarendal, opdracht voor Rijksbouwmeester en gemeente Arnhem
* Participatieplan voor stedelijk vernieuwingsplan Aireystrook in Amsterdam Nieuw-West, woningcorporatie Eigen Haard
* Marktconsultatie en strategiebepaling Kanaleneiland Noord in Utrecht, woningcorporatie Mitros
* Landelijke verkenning en uitwisseling naar de toekomst van woningcorporaties in Corporatie 2020
* Marktconsultatie voor Stationsomgeving Lelylaan, Gemeente Amsterdam, stadsdeel Nieuw-West
* Trainingsleider voor diverse Trainingen Stedelijke Strategie, waaronder de Masterclass Dordrecht en het VNG Traineeprogramma
* Projectleider voor verschillende internationale kennisuitwisselingen naar Dublin en Oost London: stedelijke ontwikkeling na de crisis, geleefde en geplande stad en de civic economy
* Toekomstvisie Albrandswaard in co-creatie met de bevolking en stakeholders, gericht op een grotere zelforganisatie en de wording van de Regiegemeente; relatie met structuurvisie
* Tijdelijkheidsstrategie voor de Rijnhaven, gemeente Alphen aan den Rijn.

profile_positions.description:
“STIPO offers an open window to a better city.”
We are a multi-disciplinary office for urban development, based in Amsterdam, Rotterdam, Stockholm and Thessaloniki. We work on the city at eye level and placemaking, social innovation, area development and co-creation in strategy and vision. As a public developer we start initiatives to bring new ideas from strategy to action.
www.stipo.nl
www.facebook.com/stipoteam
www.thecityateyelevel.com
profile_positions.title: Partner, public developer and founder
Initiator, author, public developer

profile_positions.description: Placemaking Europe is the leading network for placemaking in Europe. It is part of the global network and PlacemakingX.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder and Board Member

profile_positions.description: STIPO and Stadkwadraat have launched the Citymaker Fund as matchmaker between citymakers (re:Kreators, placemakers) and investors. The Citymaker Fund actively contributes to a lively and inclusive city by investing in initiatives with social and fair economic return. The Fund helps initiatives by buying property or land, or by helping to finance construction or renewal of buildings. To enable social return and sustain this in the city, the fund has a low interest on loans. Additionally, the fund advises citymakers on setting up feasible business models.
profile_positions.title: Chairman Of The Board
Senior Advisor and Member of the Startup Board

profile_positions.description: Stichting WE The People is the foundation behind WE The City, seeking interaction between people and setting up the conditions for people to paint the canvas of their cities. An example is Benches Day during which people with a bench in front of their house are invited to be part of the world's larges outdoor cafe.
profile_positions.title: Board Member

profile_positions.description: The Broedstraten Foundation manages five 'Broedstraten' (Incubator Streets) in Amsterdam-North. A Broedstraat is occupied by artists who live and work there. Led by a street coordinator they collaborate with the residents and businesses from the neighbourhood on art projects that make the street a better and more livable place.
profile_positions.title: Board Member

company.name: Inspiring Cities, international network for cities and culture

profile_positions.description: Inspiring Cities is the international network for cities and culture
profile_positions.title: Board member and founder

profile_positions.description: Design in Society is the interdisciplinary excellency programme of Hogeschool Rotterdam, set up by Eric Reiman, dealing with issues such as the language of the city, urban experience research methods and the public realm.
profile_positions.title: Gastdocent Design in Society

profile_positions.description: Opzetten van een plintenbeleid en uitvoeringsstrategie voor de plinten in de binnenstad van Rotterdam, als bijdrage aan het binnenstadsprogramma City Lounge.
profile_positions.title: Projectmanager Plintenstrategie Binnenstad Rotterdam

volunteer_experiences.description:
- Board member for Peuterspeelzaal Rozengracht, a childcare facility run by parents in Amsterdam
- Board member for the Broedstraten Foundation, a foundation bringing culture into the neighbourhoods of Amsterdam Noord
- Board member for Inspiring Cities, an international foundation sharing inspiration about culture, soul and cities
- Board member for We the City Foundation, a foundation organizing activations in public space, among others the Benches Collective
